summary: An internal FBI email from Public Affairs Specialist Amy Thoreson to colleagues Michael Osborn and Sean Watson, forwarding media inquiries about rumors that the FBI had located Ghislaine Maxwell. It shows the FBI was monitoring media speculation about Maxwell's whereabouts in October 2019.

persons.name: Amy J. Thoreson
persons.context: Author of the email, forwarding media inquiries about rumors the FBI had located Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Michael A. Osborn
persons.context: Recipient of the email about media inquiries regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Sean P. Watson
persons.context: Recipient of the email about media inquiries regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The media was inquiring about rumors that the FBI had located her.

connections.description: Thoreson is emailing Osborn as an FBI colleague to pass on media information.
Thoreson is emailing Watson as an FBI colleague to pass on media information.
Both are recipients of the same FBI email regarding media inquiries.
Thoreson, as an FBI public affairs specialist, is handling media inquiries about the investigation into Maxwell's whereabouts.

events.title: Media inquiry about FBI locating Maxwell
events.description: Media contacted the FBI New York office with rumors that the FBI had found Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: In October 2019, media outlets were actively speculating and inquiring with the FBI about whether they had located Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email shows internal FBI communication regarding public and media interest in the Maxwell investigation.
Ghislaine Maxwell's whereabouts were a subject of significant media and public interest at the time.
The FBI's New York Public Affairs office was fielding these inquiries.
